data.title: Sun Media shuffles senior management team
data.meta_description: Sun Media Corp. announced four senior appointments yesterday. After three years as publisher of the Toronto Sun and 24 Hours, Kin-Man Lee was appointed chief financial officer of Sun Media Corp. Lee joined the company in 1989. He held a series of senior financial positions with The Bowes Publishers Ltd. subsidiary, a publisher of community […]
data.text:
Sun Media Corp. announced four senior appointments yesterday.

After three years as publisher of the Toronto Sun and 24 Hours, Kin-Man Lee was appointed chief financial officer of Sun Media Corp.

Lee joined the company in 1989. He held a series of senior financial positions with The Bowes Publishers Ltd. subsidiary, a publisher of community newspapers, before becoming VP, finance and administration of Sun Media Corp. He then become VP and chief financial officer in 2005 and executive VP in 2006.

Michael Power, previously VP, advertising sales at the Toronto Sun and 24 Hours, was promoted to publisher of the Toronto Sun.

Power, who joined the ad team at the newspaper 19 years ago, was most recently senior group publisher for North Central Ontario at Osprey Media and publisher and general manager of The Barrie Examiner.

Stephen Evans, a new technology strategist and until recently chief technology officer of Canoe, was promoted to senior VP, information technology, of the recently merged Sun Media Corp./Canoe organization. Evans joined Canoe in 2007 as VP and editor of emerging products.

Chris Brockbank, a senior marketing specialist and currently VP, marketing of Sun Media Corp., will take on additional responsibilities, overseeing the 24 Hours product for the entire Sun Media chain.

“The new roles… reflect Sun Media Corporation’s determination to seize the opportunities created by the new media landscape by harnessing its people’s leading-edge skills,” said Pierre Karl Péladeau, president and CEO of Quebecor and Sun Media Corp., in a release.

“The profound changes underway in our industry are forcing us to reinvent ourselves. With this seasoned management team we are further strengthening our leadership as an integrated multimedia company in these challenging times.”

The reorganization of Sun Media Corp.’s senior management team has led to the departure of Jack Mulchinock, formerly senior VP, technology, and John Leader, formerly VP, finance.
